definition: to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to cause damage to/to ruin/to destroy

sentences.english: System was out of memory, executable file was corrupt, or relocations were invalid.
sentences.chinese: 系统内存不足，可执行文件损错误或重新定位无效。

sentences.english: Less commonly, the skin lesions begin as pruritic red macules or papules .
sentences.chinese: 在少数情况，皮肤病损开始于瘙痒的红色斑疹或丘疹。

sentences.english: But under the high-speed development it hides many problems such as the negative spread.
sentences.chinese: 但行业在高速发展的同时也出现了利差损这样的问题。

sentences.english: The steps have been rubbed down by the passing of so many feet.
sentences.chinese: 这些台阶被如此众多来往的脚步蹋损了。

sentences.english: That picture got damaged (or was damaged ) when we were moving.
sentences.chinese: 我们搬家的时候那张画受了损。

sentences.english: To introduce the mechanism of atrophia diseases briefly.
sentences.chinese: 分析痿病毒损络脉的机制。

sentences.english: Others by first do no harm, or take no more than you need.
sentences.chinese: 有人相信首先不要损人，或仅取所需。

sentences.english: In all honesty, o man, don't stop the advance of others.
sentences.chinese: 诚以待人，严以律己，自求奋进，勿损他人。

sentences.english: I say you say this child no big or little damage that can be enough.
sentences.chinese: 我说你这孩子说话没大没小的可够损的。

definition: to harm others/to mock people/to taunt/humiliating
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
to save a little only to lose a lot (idiom)
deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
to destroy/to damage/to ruin/to defame/to slander
variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to defame/to slander
